records.full_caption: Fig. 1 Synthesis and physicochemical properties of PBBT-H and PBBT-Me. (a) Synthetic route of PBBT-H and PBBT-Me. (b) CV of PBBT-H and PBBT-Me in 0.1 M n-Bu4NPF6 acetonitrile solution. (c) and (d) UV-vis-NIR absorption spectra of PBBT-H and PBBT-Me in diluted MSA solutions (c) and thin films (d).
records.caption: UV-vis-NIR absorption spectra of PBBT-H and PBBT-Me in thin films.

Fig. 3  Differential spectroelectrochemistry. (a) and (b) Differential absorption spectra of PBBT-H (a) and PBBT-Me (b). (c) Differential absorption spectra of PBBT-H (c) and PBBT-Me (d) at select wavelengths. In all these spectroelectrochemistry measurements, 0.1 M NaCl aqueous solution was used as the electrolyte, Ag/AgCl electrode was grounded, and the voltage was applied to the polymer films scanning between 0 V and 1.0 V versus Ag/AgCl electrode.
records.caption: Differential absorption spectra of PBBT-H at select wavelengths.

Fig. 5 OECT-based inverters. (a) and (b) Typical voltage transfer characteristics (VTC) of the inverters at various supply voltages (from 0.2 to 0.7 V). (c) and (d) Voltage gains of the inverters at various supply voltages. (e) and (f) Input and output of the inverters showing “0” and “1” states. All the above inverters consisted of an n-type (BBL) and a p-type OECT (PBBT-H or PBBT-Me) OECT.
records.caption: Voltage gains of the inverters at various supply voltages.

records.full_caption: Fig. 6 Organic electrochemical neurons based on PBBT-Me and BBL. (a) Schematic of the leaky-integrate-and-fire (LIF) type spiking neuron, comprising both p-type and n-type accumulation-mode OECTs. (b) Typical spiking behaviors of a LIF-neuron based on PBBT-Me and BBL, gated using Ag/AgCl and working at In = 2 μA in 0.1 M NaCl aqueous solution. (c) Spiking frequency and Vfire,max of the LIF-neuron at different In. (d) Spiking patterns at In = 2 μA for 0 h, 3 h, and 6.5 h. (e) Spiking frequencies of the LIF-neuron change over time at In = 0.25 μA, 1 μA, 6 μA during 6.5 h of continuous operation. (f) Evolution of the Vfire,max over time at In = 0.25 μA, 1 μA, 6 μA during 6.5 h of continuous operation.
records.caption: Evolution of the Vfire,max over time at In = 0.25 μA, 1 μA, 6 μA during 6.5 h of continuous operation.
